import styles from "./DoubtsPage.module.css"; import {useState} from 'react'; const DoubtsPage = () => { const [doubts, setDoubts] = useState([{id: 1, sender:"Dumas", title:"Doubt", body:"Hello world"},{id: 1, sender:"Dumas", title:"Doubt", body:"Hello world"}]); const s = () => {}; const displayProfile = () => {}; // Gets all the profile info displayed const displayRooms = () => {}; // Gets all the rooms of a user displayed const displayRightSideBar = () => {}; const addDoubt = (doubtobj) => { // Adds a new doubt to the inner HTML through useState doubts. Takes an object let x = [doubtobj]; for (let i = 0; i = doubts.length; i++) { x.push(doubts[i]); } setDoubts(x); console.log("HI"); }; const refreshDoubts = () => {}; // to be triggered when a WebSockets request is loaded const test = () => { addDoubt({id: 2, sender:"SLex", title:"Shit", body:"Hello"}); } return (

This is just a sample doubt with some main question. I just wanted the question in two lines.

This is some random text which will serve as the place holder for the question description. Forgive my rambling but I have to do this in order to occupy some space in the question bubble. Now, let us see how this can be made responsive.
